emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Development Environments
emerging_technologies.description: Fully autonomous development environments where AI can write, test, and deploy software with minimal human oversight.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces the demand for basic coding skills, shifts focus towards design and management of software, raises concerns about job displacement.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High initial cost, regulatory approval for autonomous systems, need for new educational paradigms.

emerging_technologies.name: Neuralink Integration
emerging_technologies.description: Integration of brain-computer interfaces for controlling devices, enhancing cognitive abilities, and direct human-to-human communication.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for significant cognitive enhancement, ethical concerns regarding privacy and consent, changes in social interaction.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Public acceptance, ethical and regulatory hurdles, technological reliability.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum-Resistant Blockchain
emerging_technologies.description: Development of blockchain systems resistant to quantum computing attacks, ensuring long-term security of transactions and data.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Strengthens digital security infrastructure, necessary for the protection of sensitive data against future threats.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Need for consensus among blockchain communities, compatibility with existing systems, research into quantum algorithms.

emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Urban Infrastructure
emerging_technologies.description: Infrastructure that adapts in real-time to traffic, energy needs, and public service demands, optimizing city operations.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances urban living but raises issues with privacy, surveillance, and control over public spaces.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Cost of deployment, public trust, regulatory frameworks for autonomous systems.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI Pair Programming
mainstream_technologies.description: AI systems that not only assist in coding but actively participate in the software development process, including design and testing.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in tech companies, becoming standard in software development practices.

mainstream_technologies.name: Space Tourism
mainstream_technologies.description: Commercial space travel for tourists, with regular scheduled flights to low Earth orbit.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: A niche but growing market, primarily for the wealthy, with potential for broader adoption as costs decrease.

epoch_themes.description: An era where autonomous systems are integrated into nearly all aspects of human life, from daily tasks to complex decision-making.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Reduces human error in critical systems, increases efficiency, but also leads to debates over control, employment, and ethics.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased automation in industries, shift in employment focus from manual to oversight roles, growth in regulatory frameworks for autonomous tech.

epoch_themes.description: Focus on enhancing human capabilities through technology, from physical to cognitive enhancements.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Potential for reduced inequality in access to knowledge and abilities, but also raises issues of fairness and the essence of being human.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Rise in bioethics discussions, legislative measures for augmentation technologies, and new forms of human rights concerning cognitive freedom.
